thread.title: Clinton and Sanders dominate policy-deep Democratic debate
thread.title_full: Clinton and Sanders dominate policy-deep Democratic debate

author: PBS NewsHour
title: Clinton and Sanders dominate policy-deep Democratic debate
text: Clinton and Sanders dominate policy-deep Democratic debate October 14, 2015 at 6:40 PM EDT 159518 159528 159528 Clinton and Sanders dominate policy-deep Democratic debate The first Democratic debate between five presidential candidates sharpened into a two-person heavyweight match between between Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton over capitalism and gun control. Political director Lisa Desjardins reports. 2015-10-14 18:00:00 disabled 2365583323 ffKPG2fZE6A 159413 159393 http://www.pbs.org/newshour/bb/last-presidents-men-sheds-light-nixons-vulnerability-motivation/ New book sheds light on Nixon’s vulnerability, motivation In “The Last of the President’s Men,” journalist Bob Woodward offers a whole new understanding of Richard Nixon. Using interviews with Nixon’s deputy assistant, Alexander Butterfield, and thousands of documents, Woodward reveals previously unexplored sides of the president. Woodward and Butterfield discuss with Judy Woodruff the Nixon we didn’t see. 2015-10-13 18:00:00 http://www.pbs.org/newshour/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/nhbookshelf-320x196.jpg 2365582365 RL6wgjNQBdo 159406 159389 http://www.pbs.org/newshour/bb/biden-wont-stage-will-impact-debate/ Biden won’t be on the stage, but will he impact the debate? Will Joe Biden join the presidential race? That’s been a lingering question for weeks, especially going into the first Democratic debate. Political director Lisa Desjardins talks with Judy Woodruff about the man who’s not going to be on the debate stage, as well as what to expect from the five candidates who will be in Las Vegas. 2015-10-13 18:00:00 http://www.pbs.org/newshour/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/RTS4BAV-320x196.jpg 2365582377 W7NiIszAhTI 159293 159262 http://www.pbs.org/newshour/bb/sanders-omalley-will-try-stand-first-debate/ How Sanders, O'Malley will try to stand out in the debate President Obama weighed in on Hillary Clinton's use of a private email server, while a former GOP staffer came out to say that the Benghazi Committee was politically motivated against Clinton. Will those issues start to fade? Judy Woodruff talks with Amy Walter of the Cook Political Report and Tamara Keith of NPR about the upcoming Democratic debate and the the GOP House speaker saga. 2015-10-12 18:00:00 http://www.pbs.org/newshour/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/467150086-320x196.jpg 2365581675 FZ9nq99oVA8 The first Democratic debate between five presidential candidates sharpened into a two-person heavyweight match between between Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton over capitalism and gun control. Political director Lisa Desjardins reports. RELATED
